text: this recipe is a take on those really
popular toaster pastries that most kids
love and most adults love to eat as well
but this one's made really healthy with
some holy gram flour and cream cheese in
the dough and a raspberry jam filling
it's very delicious and really fun to
make get started one and a quarter cups
of whole wheat gram flour which has a
really nice nutty flavor and then one
and a quarter cups of all-purpose flour
good to balance out an alternative flour
like a gram flour with a good amount of
regular flour as well just to give it
structure one and a half teaspoons of
coarse salt as always to bring out the
flavor just combine these quickly in the
food processor
then four ounces of cream cheese this is
going to add some really nice richness
to the dough very cold and cut into
small cubes and then half a cup of cold
unsalted butter really tiny cubes you
want it very cold so that when you
process it it stays in little lumps
which will add really nice lovely layers
to the pastry just gonna post this now
ice water half a cup of ice water plus
one tablespoon put the top on and pulse
you can see it start to come together I
don't want a ball of dough in there but
I do want it thoroughly mixed so that
looks good I'm gonna bring it together
in a piece of plastic wrap hold the ends
together and knead it together with your
fingers just to bring the dough together
this is exactly what you would do with a
pie crust press it down and really get
it together so now that I have it
together divide it in half with the
bench scraper so wrap that up and then
the other one okay so these go into the
refrigerator to chill just about thirty
minutes just to get them to relax you
can chill for longer but then bring back
to a little bit before room temperature
so that you'll be able to roll them out
into the fridge okay the dough is
chilled it's nice and pliable so I'm
going to ready to roll it out do one
piece at a time
so I've got a piece of parchment lightly
flour it take this guy out of the
plastic I'm going for about a 10 by 14
14 and 1/2 inch rectangle key is to keep
moving this around and make sure there's
flour under there okay so this one put
onto the baking sheet then put this back
in the refrigerator get it nice and cold
and roll out the second
so the dough's are rolled out and now we
could sandwich them so one cup of
raspberry jam
put it right on to the bottom one and
spread it out but leave a border so
we're gonna sandwich that second dough
on top so we don't want to spread it all
the way to the edges now you could
really use any type of Jam here whatever
is your favorite just not something with
too many big chunks I've had about a 1
inch border all the way around so this
one I'm going to use the rolling pin to
roll up the dough and then I'll line up
the bottom edge and unroll this one on
top now just press down on those edges
just to kind of adhere the two dough's
together
okay then fluted pastry wheel this will
trim all the edges make it look nice and
neat and the top one okay other side now
times my egg wash
one egg break it into a bowl beat it
quickly together with a fork
now just brush this all over the top
this is gonna give a really nice shine
to the top of the dough okay now just
like a pie we need some vents in the top
so small paring knife and just make some
slits through the top pastry only you
don't want to go all the way down to the
bottom now I can feel my dough is a
little bit soft here so I'm going to
chill this before I bake it okay it
looks great all set for the refrigerator
okay the pastry is chilled so now we're
going to go into 375 degree oven so in
some really gold and browns it'll be
about 35 minutes so the final touch is
the milk glaze just a little bit of milk
into a half a cup of confectioner's
sugar so I like to use a spoon and we'll
just do some long drizzles over the top
this is really that touch of sweetness
at the end
so good you could leave it off but why
would you want to okay that looks so
delicious look at that beautiful jam
filling looks so good you can see all
the flaky layers of the pastry with the
jam and the milk glaze this will be a
hit at any party for sure
